docs.snippet: Brazil, the only South American team to win a World Cup on three continents, will have a decided advantage in 2014. Six times the host has won the tournament and no European team has won outside of Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA made it official today: Brazil will host the 2014 World Cup (Germany will host the Women's World Cup in 2011). This comes as no surprise as the five-time champion was the only country in the running.

docs.snippet: Brazil, which has won a record five World Cups, was awarded the 2014 tournament yesterday by FIFA’s executive committee. Brazil last was the host of the competition in 1950, losing to Uruguay in the final. The unanimous vote came on the same day...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil, which has won a record five World Cups, was awarded the 2014 tournament yesterday by FIFA’s executive committee. Brazil last was the host of the competition in 1950, losing to Uruguay in the final. The unanimous vote came on the same day the 2011 Women’s World Cup was awarded to Germany, which beat out Canada. Germany was the host for the 2006 men’s World Cup. Brazil was the only candidate for the men’s 2014 World Cup because the rotation system meant it had to be played in South America. Colombia had said it would bid but withdrew in April.
